data.name: AccessibleName
data.value: Eina de codificació i descodificació de JWT

data.name: acr
data.value: La reclamació "acr" amb un valor de 0 indica que l'autenticació de l'usuari final no compleix els requisits de la norma ISO/IEC 29115.

data.name: acrs
data.value: La reclamació "acrs" indica els ID de context d'autenticació de les operacions que el portador pot realitzar. Els identificadors de context d'autenticació es poden utilitzar per activar una demanda d'autenticació accelerada des de la vostra aplicació i serveis. S'utilitza sovint juntament amb la reclamació xms_cc.

data.name: aio
data.value: La reclamació "aio" és una reclamació interna utilitzada per Microsoft Entra ID per registrar dades per a la reutilització del testimoni. Els recursos no haurien d'utilitzar aquesta reclamació.

data.name: alg
data.value: Inidica l'algoritme utilitzat per signar el token

data.name: amr
data.value: La reclamació "amr" identifica el mètode d'autenticació del subjecte del testimoni.

data.name: appid
data.value: La reclamació "appid" indica l'identificador de l'aplicació del client que utilitza el testimoni. L'aplicació pot actuar com a ella mateixa o en nom d'un usuari. L'ID d'aplicació normalment representa un objecte d'aplicació, però també pot representar un objecte principal de servei a Microsoft Entra ID.

data.name: appidacr
data.value: La reclamació "aplicacr" indica el mètode d'autenticació del client. Per a un client públic, el valor és 0. Quan utilitzeu l'ID de client i el secret de client, el valor és 1. Quan utilitzeu un certificat de client per a l'autenticació, el valor és 2.

data.name: aud
data.value: La reclamació "aud" (audiència) identifica els destinataris als quals està destinat el JWT. Cada director que pretén processar el JWT HA d'identificar-se amb un valor a la reclamació de l'audiència. Si el principal que processa la reclamació no s'identifica amb un valor de la reclamació "aud" quan aquesta reclamació està present, el JWT S'HA DE rebutjar. En el cas general, el valor "aud" és una matriu de cadenes sensibles a majúscules i minúscules, cadascuna conté un valor StringOrURI. En el cas especial quan el JWT té un públic, el valor "aud" POT ser una cadena única que distingeix entre majúscules i minúscules que conté un valor StringOrURI. La interpretació dels valors de l'audiència és generalment específica de l'aplicació. L'ús d'aquesta reclamació és OPCIONAL.

data.name: azp
data.value: La reclamació "azp" és un reemplaçament d'appid. L'identificador de l'aplicació del client que utilitza el testimoni. L'aplicació pot actuar com a ella mateixa o en nom d'un usuari. L'ID d'aplicació normalment representa un objecte d'aplicació, però també pot representar un objecte principal de servei a Microsoft Entra ID.

data.name: azpacr
data.value: La reclamació "azpacr" és un reemplaçament d'apidacr. Indica el mètode d'autenticació del client. Per a un client públic, el valor és 0. Quan utilitzeu l'ID de client i el secret de client, el valor és 1. Quan utilitzeu un certificat de client per a l'autenticació, el valor és 2.

data.name: DecodeValidateTokenSettingsDescription
data.value: Selecciona quins paràmetres del token a validar

data.name: DecodeValidateTokenSettingsTitle
data.value: Configuració de la validació del token

data.name: Description
data.value: Codifica i descodifica Json Web Token

data.name: exp
data.value: The "exp" (expiration time) claim identifies the expiration time on or after which the JWT MUST NOT be accepted for processing. The processing of the "exp" claim requires that the current date/time MUST be before the expiration date/time listed in the "exp" claim. Implementers MAY provide for some small leeway, usually no more than a few minutes, to account for clock skew. Its value MUST be a number containing a NumericDate value. Use of this claim is OPTIONAL.

data.name: groups
data.value: The "groups" claim provides object IDs that represent the group memberships of the subject. The groupMembershipClaims property of the application manifest configures the groups claim on a per-application basis. A value of null excludes all groups, a value of SecurityGroup includes only Active Directory Security Group memberships, and a value of All includes both Security Groups and Microsoft 365 Distribution Lists.See the hasgroups claim for details on using the groups claim with the implicit grant. For other flows, if the number of groups the user is in goes over 150 for SAML and 200 for JWT, then Microsoft Entra ID adds an overage claim to the claim sources. The claim sources point to the Microsoft Graph endpoint that contains the list of groups for the user.

data.name: groups:src1
data.value: The "groups:src1" claim includes a link to the full groups list for the user when token requests are too large for the token. For JWTs as a distributed claim, for SAML as a new claim in place of the groups claim.Example JWT Value:"groups":"src1""_claim_sources: "src1" : { "endpoint" : "https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/{userID}/getMemberObjects" }

data.name: hasgroups
data.value: If present, always true, indicates whether the user is in at least one group. Used in place of the groups claim for JWTs in implicit grant flows if the full groups claim would extend the URI fragment beyond the URL length limits (currently six or more groups). Indicates that the client should use the Microsoft Graph API to determine the groups (https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/{userID}/getMemberObjects) of the user.

data.name: iat
data.value: The "iat" (issued at) claim identifies the time at which the JWT was issued. This claim can be used to determine the age of the JWT. Its value MUST be a number containing a NumericDate value. Use of this claim is OPTIONAL.

data.name: idp
data.value: The "idp" claim records the identity provider that authenticated the subject of the token. This value is identical to the value of the Issuer claim unless the user account isn't in the same tenant as the issuer, such as guests. Use the value of iss if the claim isn't present.

data.name: InvalidExpiration
data.value: La data de caducitat no és vàlida

data.name: iss
data.value: The "iss" (issuer) claim identifies the principal that issued the JWT. The processing of this claim is generally application specific. The "iss" value is a case-sensitive string containing a StringOrURI value. Use of this claim is OPTIONAL.

data.name: jti
data.value: The "jti" (JWT ID) claim provides a unique identifier for the JWT. The identifier value MUST be assigned in a manner that ensures that there is a negligible probability that the same value will be accidentally assigned to a different data object; if the application uses multiple issuers, collisions MUST be prevented among values produced by different issuers as well. The "jti" claim can be used to prevent the JWT from being replayed. The "jti" value is a case- sensitive string. Use of this claim is OPTIONAL.

data.name: kid
data.value: Specifies the thumbprint for the public key used for validating the signature of the token.

data.name: name
data.value: The "name" claim provides a human-readable value that identifies the subject of the token. The value can vary, it's mutable, and is for display purposes only. To receive this claim, use the profile scope.

data.name: nbf
data.value: The "nbf" (not before) claim identifies the time before which the JWT MUST NOT be accepted for processing. The processing of the "nbf" claim requires that the current date/time MUST be after or equal to the not-before date/time listed in the "nbf" claim. Implementers MAY provide for some small leeway, usually no more than a few minutes, to account for clock skew. Its value MUST be a number containing a NumericDate value. Use of this claim is OPTIONAL.

data.name: oid
data.value: The immutable identifier for the requestor, which is the verified identity of the user or service principal. This ID uniquely identifies the requestor across applications. Two different applications signing in the same user receive the same value in the oid claim. The oid can be used when making queries to Microsoft online services, such as the Microsoft Graph. The Microsoft Graph returns this ID as the id property for a given user account. Because the oid allows multiple applications to correlate principals, to receive this claim for users use the profile scope. If a single user exists in multiple tenants, the user contains a different object ID in each tenant. Even though the user logs into each account with the same credentials, the accounts are different.

data.name: preferred_username
data.value: The "preferred_username" claim indicate the primary username that represents the user. The value could be an email address, phone number, or a generic username without a specified format. Use the value for username hints and in human-readable UI as a username. To receive this claim, use the profile scope.

data.name: PrivateKeyNotSupported
data.value: Aquest tipus de clau privada no està suportada

data.name: PublicKeyNotSupported
data.value: Aquest tipus de clau pública no està suportada

data.name: rh
data.value: The "rh" claim is an internal claim used by Azure to revalidate tokens. Resources shouldn't use this claim.

data.name: roles
data.value: The "roles" claim indicate the set of permissions exposed by the application that the requesting application or user has been given permission to call. The client credential flow uses this set of permission in place of user scopes for application tokens. For user tokens, this set of values contains the assigned roles of the user on the target application.

data.name: scp
data.value: The "scp" claim indicate the set of scopes exposed by the application for which the client application has requested (and received) consent. Only included for user tokens.

data.name: sub
data.value: The "sub" (subject) claim identifies the principal that is the subject of the JWT. The claims in a JWT are normally statements about the subject. The subject value MUST either be scoped to be locally unique in the context of the issuer or be globally unique. The processing of this claim is generally application specific. The "sub" value is a case-sensitive string containing a StringOrURI value. Use of this claim is OPTIONAL.

data.name: tid
data.value: The "tid" claim represents the tenant that the user is signing in to. For work and school accounts, the GUID is the immutable tenant ID of the organization that the user is signing in to.

data.name: unique_name
data.value: The "unique_name" claim provides a human readable value that identifies the subject of the token.

data.name: uti
data.value: The "uti" claim (Token identifier claim), is equivalent to "jti" in the JWT specification. Unique, per-token identifier that is case-sensitive.

data.name: ver
data.value: The "ver" claim indicates the version of the access token.

data.name: wids
data.value: The "wids" claim denotes the tenant-wide roles assigned to this user, from the section of roles present in Microsoft Entra built-in roles. The groupMembershipClaims property of the application manifest configures this claim on a per-application basis. Set the claim to All or DirectoryRole. May not be present in tokens obtained through the implicit flow due to token length concerns.

data.name: x5t
data.value: Functions the same as "kid". "x5t" is a legacy claim emitted only in v1.0 access tokens for compatibility purposes.

data.name: xms_cc
data.value: The "xms_cc" claim indicates whether the client application that acquired the token is capable of handling claims challenges. It's often used along with claim acrs. This claim is commonly used in Conditional Access and Continuous Access Evaluation scenarios. The resource server or service application that the token is issued for controls the presence of this claim in a token. A value of cp1 in the access token is the authoritative way to identify that a client application is capable of handling a claims challenge.

data.name: InvalidHeader
data.value: Unable to process the token header

data.name: InvalidPayload
data.value: Unable to process the token payload

data.name: InvalidPrivateKey
data.value: Private key is either null or empty

data.name: InvalidPublicKey
data.value: Public key is either null or empty

data.name: InvalidSignature
data.value: No es pot processar la signatura del token
